org.codehaus.preon.buffer
Class SlicedBitBuffer

java.lang.Object
  org.codehaus.preon.buffer.SlicedBitBuffer
All Implemented Interfaces:
BitBuffer
public class SlicedBitBuffer
extends Object
implements BitBuffer

A BitBuffer that acts upon a slice of the underyling BitBuffer.

Author:
Wilfred Springer

readAsBoolean

public boolean readAsBoolean()
Description copied from interface: BitBuffer
Read one specified bit starting from the current bit pointer position in the big endian order, return the value as boolean and move the bit pointer one bit ahead. After reading the pointer will indicate the position of the first bit that has not been read yet.

Specified by:
readAsBoolean in interface BitBuffer
Returns:
value represented by specified bit

readAsBoolean

public boolean readAsBoolean(long bitPos)
Description copied from interface: BitBuffer
Read one specified bit starting from the given bit position in the big endian order, return the value as boolean and move the bit pointer one bit ahead. After reading the pointer will indicate the position of the position of the first bit that has not been read yet.

Specified by:
readAsBoolean in interface BitBuffer
Parameters:
bitPos - position of the bit to read in the bit buffer
Returns:
value represented by specified bit

readAsBoolean

public boolean readAsBoolean(ByteOrder endian)
Description copied from interface: BitBuffer
Read one specified bit starting from the current bit pointer position in either the little- or big-endian order, move the value as boolean and move the bit pointer one bit ahead. After reading the pointer will indicate the position of the first bit that has not been read yet.

Specified by:
readAsBoolean in interface BitBuffer
Parameters:
endian - order of reading bytes (either Endian.Big or Endian.Little)

readAsLong

public long readAsLong(long bitPos,
                       int nrBits)
Description copied from interface: BitBuffer
Read specified number of bits (max 64) starting from the given bit position in the big endian order, return the value as long (signed) and move the bit pointer the given number of bits ahead. After reading the pointer will indicate the position of the first bit that has not been read yet. The bytes are read in the big-endian order.

Specified by:
readAsLong in interface BitBuffer

slice

public BitBuffer slice(long length)
Description copied from interface: BitBuffer
Returns a new BitBuffer, starting at BitBuffer.getBitPos(), with the given length. Moves the current position in this BitBuffer to BitBuffer.getBitPos() + length. Note that each BitBuffer is assumed to be completely independent of the other, even though both are backed by the same data.

Specified by:
slice in interface BitBuffer
Parameters:
length - The number of bits to be included in the slice.

duplicate

public BitBuffer duplicate()
Description copied from interface: BitBuffer
Duplicates the current BitBuffer. The new BitBuffer is guaranteed to have its own index to the current position. The only thing the copy shares in common with its origin from which it was duplicated is the backing data structure. Apart from that, they are assumed to be completely independent.

Specified by:
duplicate in interface BitBuffer
Returns:
A duplicate of the BitBuffer.

readAsByteBuffer

public ByteBuffer readAsByteBuffer(int length)
                            throws BitBufferUnderflowException
Description copied from interface: BitBuffer
Returns a ByteBuffer creating a view of the contents of the BitBuffer, representing the data as bytes. It will move the current position in this BitBuffer to length * 8.

Specified by:
readAsByteBuffer in interface BitBuffer
Parameters:
length - The number of bytes to be exposed throught the ByteBuffer.
Returns:
A ByteBuffer providing a byte view on a slice of the data underneath this BitBuffer.
Throws:
BitBufferUnderflowException - If the number bytes addresses a position out of reach for this BitBuffer.

readAsByteBuffer

public ByteBuffer readAsByteBuffer()
Description copied from interface: BitBuffer
Returns the contents of the underlying collection of bytes a ByteBuffer.

Specified by:
readAsByteBuffer in interface BitBuffer
